title: Chelsea transfer news: Frank Lampard reveals interest in Kurt Zouma
text:
Kurt Zouma has impressed under Frank Lampard (Picture: Getty)

Chelsea boss Frank Lampard insists he had no intention of allowing ‘fantastic’ Kurt Zouma to leave the club last summer.

The Frenchman spent last season on loan at Everton and the Toffees were keen on signing the defender permanently.

Zouma broke into the Chelsea team under Jose Mourinho in 2014 but a knee injury in 2016 derailed his time at Stamford Bridge and a future at the club looked unlikely after loan spells with Stoke and Everton.

But the 25-year-old has turned things around in west London and has made himself a regular again under Lampard.

Zouma has made 14 appearances this season (Picture: Getty)

Injury to Antonio Rudiger opened up an opportunity for Zouma to impress but Lampard insists the defender was always in his plans.

‘He has been fantastic,’ said Lampard.

‘There was a belief that I had in Kurt because there was interest in the summer after we all know he had a very good loan at Everton last year.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘But I believed in him as I believed in Tomori – that is why I made the decisions I made pre-season in terms of where we were going to look defensively.

‘It has been nice to get some stability, albeit because of injuries, between him and Fikayo in the last games.

‘It has been good to get them playing together to see the little bond they are getting on and off the pitch. It is a nice little story and it must continue, I suppose.’

Zouma is in line to start in Chelsea’s Carabao Cup clash against Manchester United at Stamford Bridge tonight.

Lampard’s first game in charge was a 4-0 drubbing against the Red Devils at Old Trafford but the Blues have fared better since and are seven points ahead of Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s side in the table.

And Lampard insists it would have been easy to listen to the critics after that defeat but he was right to stick with his ‘young’ side.

‘There is a lot of noise, win, lose or draw; selection, whatever 11 I pick,’ said Lampard.

‘With this big wide world of social media we have now it will be dissected and people will have different opinions and some people who are ex players or ex managers will have different opinions.

‘For me to have thrown that away after one game at Manchester United and a few opinions, that would have made me a bit of a flip-flopper.’
